CSRF.question: What does CSRF stand for?
CSRF.info: A little bit of info here

CSRF.question: CSRF can be described as:
answers: An attack when malicious code modifies your website to display unwanted information
An attack against a webapplications database

An attack which results in a request being submitted 
on the user's behalf without their consent
CSRF.info: A little bit of info here

SQL-Injection.question: What is a SQL-Injection Attack?
answers: When a hacker tries to embed harmful/malicious code into someones email
When a hacker tries to “inject” harmful/malicious SQL code into someone else’s database
When a hacker hides harmful/malicious SQL code inside a cookie

SQL-Injection.question: Which example makes a SQL-Injection possible:
answers:
When 'Username' and 'Password' from an inputfield 
are directly inserted into a SQL-statement
When a cookie is badly written
When 'Username' and 'Password' are written in foreign caracters when you log in to a website
SQL-Injection.info: A little bit of info here

XSS.question: XSS can be described as:
answers: A code on your website that was badly written
A coded command/malicious script that is inputed to your website
When a user tries to log in to your website but gets an error message
